text: My husband and I ate there on Saturday we order the beef noodle soup before I could eat mine my husband was stirring his soup and found a beetle in his soup so gross we will not be going back

On the stretch of road that is between the Encore (awesome) and the Riviera (dumpy) my friend and I came across a strip mall.  We were heading for Circus Circus, just for the pure curiosity of seeing a casino based around clowns.  I was starving, so the A-frame sign on Las Vegas Blvd caught my eye...$5.99 lunch special.  After a bit of meandering around the crappy shopping plaza, next to the closed wedding chapel we found Ping Pong Thai.  It was late afternoon, so it was pretty empty.  

Overall, I think it was a winner. The Thai food wasn't the best I have ever had, but it was definitely good.  The service was very nice and prompt.  The prices were really low.  Our check was so small I felt bad for the waitress, especially since she told us she had been stiffed by a party earlier in the day that returned their 'cashew chicken' because it had cashews in it.  Rejects.  Anyway, so I left her about a 75% tip.

I suppose this is the new Ping Pong, as there is one already on Sunset Road.  

If you are staying at the Encore and want to save a bit of money, you might want to pop in here for lunch or dinner.
Some of the best Thai food ever! The prices are great and the staff are super friendly. I eat here at least 2 times a month.
Ok I've passed this place alot and finally tried it cozy little spot not crowded even for a Saturday night,the service was good,the food was ok ....
